file_content.text: I don't believe it. I just-- How? You rigged it. I don't know how, but you rigged this!
You wish to defend your wager then? I will gladly finish what we have started if you feel cheated.
You should pay the Wookiee.
You've got little to complain about. You got your bout of the century, people will flock to you to arrange future fights.
But my... real gladiators are so expensive.... It's better than nothing.
When you find your tongue, it better have something nice to say.
Con... congratulations on your victory.
I'll have to draw up the contract. I'll send someone to deliver it to your bar tomorrow.
If you'll excuse me, I need to figure out what's left of my business after this!
Worm.
Tonight we fought for honor, not for entertainment. Still....
The roar of the crowd drowning out the thunder of my heart. It held nothing for me when I fought for other's gain.
I prefer not to fight unless I have to.
Then why do you learn to do it so well? Being a warrior is noble. Being a killer is not.
Worship and adoration is intoxicating in its own unique way.
I feel you would take it, were it not given. Many tyrants die that way.
I think I prefer cheers around the sabacc table, but I get what you mean.
You joke, but I am not fooled. You live dangerously. It is why I like you.
I've always fought for ideals more than glory.
There's nothing better than chasing fortune and glory.
I taste the freedom more than anything. Mine and the others.
Tonight was different?
Yes. This was the purest joy. Now I know why some of the gladiators I save stay.
The fact that this is entertainment only makes me sick.
Not everyone comes for the suffering.
Many slave warriors will call you savior today. We owe you a great debt. You may ask anything of me.
Did Hylo mention my Alliance? I'm gathering like minded people to fight Arcann. I think you'd fit right in.
Fly co-pilot with me again. Like the old days. Older days? I know it's not much in Wookiee years.
It was long enough. I would be honored to fight at your side again.
Nobody is really free until Arcann is deposed. Lend me your strength in toppling him.
I will fight him until my last breath.
I will continue to free and train slaves. I feel many would choose to join your cause as well.
If you need help, it goes both ways.
You have already done enough. I will come to you if there is trouble.
Thank you, Bowdaar. I know anyone you train will be a great asset to the Alliance.
They will be worth a thousand Sky Troopers.
As long as freedom hasn't gone to their head. I want people who can follow orders.
The prideful will likely stick to the ring.
I must prepare for my new arrivals. I will contact Hylo when I am ready.
Honor follow you wherever you tread.
You are ready to face what is to come?
Sorry, I need a little longer.
There is time.
I remember fighting at your side fondly. It felt good to do so again.
There, we understand how we fight as a whole. The droids are good for something after all.
I believe we are ready to face our enemies. Are you prepared to meet glory?
Lets free those slaves of yours.
It feels good to choose this fight.
We'll give them a show no one will forget.
No doubt.
Not yet. I have other preparations to make first.
Return when you are ready.
When I see you fight, I think it is right that Arcann fear you.
The fight masters all know you by name. My enemies will know it as well. Now we will entice them.
Your confidence in me was not misplaced.
The respect you command is well-earned.
What's the plan?
Being known to these scum is not anything I take pride in.
Take pride in depriving them of theirs.
You are even more fearsome than I remember.
Many seem eager to prove you a fluke. Now we make use of your fame.
Bowie, buddy, I've been doing that since I first crash-landed my crib.
Your skill with boasting will come in handy.
Let me in on the plan. The suspense is killing me.
Nothing I love more than correcting that kind of assumption.
You will enjoy this then.
I am inviting my enemy to speak with us. We will convince him to our terms.
Help yourself to a drink.
If I'd known you were of such modest means, I'd have invited you to my place and saved us the embarrassment.
You should be used to embarrassment. Your fighters are only fit for slaughter.
Then why do you seem so interested in buying them?
Because you squander your stock. I can make them champions. As I have with this one.
So this is the new fighter you are so proud of?
That's right.
I expected someone with more stature.
Sorry, I didn't get your name.
Valdos Dofine. You should remember it.
Isn't it your business to know?
Don't tell me what my business is.
I promote the best fights on Zakuul despite the Wookiee's refined opinion.
It is the only reason you are here. My best fighter is bored of the competition available.
Your protege has done well, I admit. But I'm proposing a different offer. A challenge match unlike any other.
I'm up for anything you throw at me.
I'm sure you are. But I don't want you. At least, not you alone.
What kind of challenge?
I don't trust you.
As you shouldn't. Yet we should listen to his offer before we judge.
I was approached by a small group of wealthy investors with a very specific request. Something beyond the common arena battles we foist upon the masses.
The Killer of Kashyyyk, undefeated for over a century, coming out of retirement for just one more match alongside his chosen protege.
No announcers, no holofeeds. A private match for the exclusive enjoyment of my investors and their invited guests.
I won't fight your slave fodder.
No, no, no, we'll put out the call. Get challengers from the Outer Rim to the Core.
Are you okay with that, Bowdaar?
That actually does sound pretty impressive.
Oh course it does. That's why I'm the best.
Just don't bore me.
My investors want a spectacle. I assure you, this will be anything but boring.
I will accept this fight. If we win, I take your entire slave stock.
If you lose. I take everything you have. If you live, I take you too.
How is that a fair deal?
My business is fine as it is. He wants me to put everything on the line, I want to see the same.
What? No way you're taking Bowdaar as a slave!
No, he will not.
You must think your slaves are truly something.
They're my livelihood, and I don't give that up lightly.
I accept your terms.
Then if you'll excuse me, I've got calls to make.
You must be pretty confident.
What were you thinking?
I am thinking we win.
I hope you're up to this.
A hundred years of fighting is not easily forgotten.
If risking my life spares others, I do it gladly. His slaves will be freed, this I swear.
We have not fought as a team in some time. Practice would not hurt. Join me in the training pit when you are ready.
We should prepare. Join me in the training pit when you are ready and we shall practice together.
You have done well. You are a recognized fighter. Fame will find you soon.
I'll keep at it.
I will be watching.
Where am I in the standings?
Firmly in the middle. Your record is exceptional, but still too short.
You are entertaining. The pit masters are eager to have you back.
[Requires Influence Level 10] Have we attracted the interest of the slavers yet?
[Requires Influence Level 10] Have we attracted the interest of the slavers yet?
I'll keep working the crowds.
Make them love you.
How much more of this am I going to have to do?
Much more. Your potential is known, but must be proven.
People are curious to see who I bring from off-world. Make a name for yourself.
I'll have them wrapped around my little blaster-finger in no time.
You just keep'em coming. I'll handle the rest.
Honor go with you.
Everything is arranged. It's up to you now. Win.
Wish me luck.
Slave fighters have no luck.
Just make sure this is worth it.
On my honor.
Good to see you again.
I've got some time for that prize fighting gig you were asking about. Still offering?
I would never refuse your help.
[Refuse Quest] Just checking in on you. Any news?
I have freed a few more slaves. My big plans still haven't budged.
Can I get you something?
I've reconsidered your request. I'll help you.
This will be a great help.
[Refuse Quest] Just taking a load off.
Stay as long as you like.
Welco--
You... you live!
Now there's a guy I've missed. The galaxies biggest warm fuzzy. How you been, big fella?
I have been well, my friend.
I'm never really alive at this hour, but I appreciate the sentiment.
Only you could find humor in your own death.
Bowdaar? You're the last person I expected to find wiping down a bar.
I enjoy it. To care for my possessions carries special meaning now.
Welcome to my establishment. It isn't much, but it is mine.
That's fantastic. And I'm not just saying that for bar privileges.
How'd you wind up with this place anyway?
I won it in a wager. Only a skilled fighter could see the champion was going to take a dive.
I don't know how you stomach the locals.
I surround myself with better company.
It has been strange since you disappeared. I realized that even after you freed me, I didn't live for myself.
When I was left on my own to decide, I decided to try a simple life.
What's the verdict? I'm curious what this "normal" is all about.
Often quiet. One could grow restless, but for now I have peace and my work is rewarding.
I might be able to convince Akaavi to settle down, but probably only while any little Mandalorians are too young to hold a blaster. So, like, three months.
Her blood ran as hot as mine when you were taken. When the rage passed, I thought of better ways to remember.
Hard to see anything simple in my future after marrying a swashbuckling crime-lord princess, but the conversation's come up.
I had never seen red-mane so hollow as when you were gone. We all grieved.
I've considered it myself. Maybe settle down on some quiet ranch and put my little farm-hand out to pasture. Sans shirt, of course.
Corso.... He wept as no warrior would want to be seen. Such is his care for you. My shoulder was damp for months.
I can see the appeal. Maybe one day, when things are a little more peaceful, I'll open my own little dive.
"One day" is not for you. You live for now. I never forget that.
So you were better off once I was gone? Gee, thanks.
You've given me the gift of life many times now. I will always be grateful.
I have hung a broken chain from a sprig of wroshyr each Life Day to honor you.
Hylo delivered a rare gift today.
I'm touched, really. I'd have sent a card, but I was busy being an ornament.
I'm sorry you felt the indignity of ownership as well.
I've had you all on my mind. I had no idea what happened after I got captured. I'm still picking up the pieces.
We all are.
I would have preferred a rescue. I nearly died frozen in a hunk of metal!
I'm sorry.... Even coming as far as Zakuul we could not find you.
These people boil my blood. They have everything and it's never enough. We are their playthings.
Welcome. We have regular specials for off-worlders.
I'm looking for the owner.
Get a lot of off-world customers here?
Only criminals. Cheap criminals. Does that say enough about the locals?
Your boss too cheap to spring for a bartender and a bouncer?
I am the boss. What I do here is my choice.
I am Bowdaar. I provide this little escape for those who need it.
A mutual friend said you needed some assistance.
Okay, well, what are the specials?
Two credits off Corellian ale and three-for-one special on blue milk going a little green.
Here. On the house.
Not much to look at.
Insult my bar again and I will add you to the decor.
Hylo said you'd be coming. What do you know of Zakuul's blood sports?
I've fought in their gladiatorial games before.
Not all are games.
They're barbaric.
You will get no disagreement from me.
They aren't so different from Mandalorian blood sport.
Mandalorians choose to fight. Not all gladiators here have that luxury.
No worse than anything on Rattatak.
I remember the brutality of the Cauldron. A privilege I paid for with much blood.
Blood sports? Sounds like my kind of competition.
If you seek test of strength and honor, you will be disappointed.
Didn't know they had any.
The locals do not suffer. They indulge their curiosity down here.
Zakuul takes slaves to die in their fighting pits. Some bought and sold, others captured in war. I help them find freedom.
If it's one thing I've learned, it's that the beauty of Zakuul only runs skin deep.
The ugliness run deep. I do what I can.
I was a slave once myself. I appreciate what you are doing here.
We must look out for our own.
That's very noble of you.
It is simply right.
So this bar is a front? Not such a simple life after all.
Call it a hobby. The locals think I'm here because their games entice me.
How do you manage that?
Credits and wagers, mostly.
Hardly seems like the powers here are doing any worse than the Hutts, or the Sith, or a dozen more like them.
Maybe so. Something about them rubs me wrong. So I do what I can.
What's your interest in doing so?
No one should be robbed of life or dignity. Slavery takes both.
Slaves who cannot earn their own freedom do not deserve it.
I almost became like you once. Convinced of my superiority. That's just a lie force fed until you believe it.
Slaves I buy are freed, but not all leave. Others I train to be great gladiators. Their winnings free more like them.
I have built up collateral for a wager like no other: to win the largest stable of slave fighters on Zakuul.
And you needed your best lucky charm. I can see why Hylo sent me.
It is your kind of gamble.
Where do I fit into all this?
That is ambitious. You could put a stop to the slave fighting.
I could never stop it. All I can do is fight it. This would be a great victory.
Why would the planet's biggest slavers hand over their operation?
Money. What else do slavers value?
My foes suggest we end our rivalry in a bloodbath, survivors reap the spoils. This is not acceptable.
I must convince them of a match worth their interest. I need a champion.
Bowdaar, the "Killer from Kashyyyk," is asking me, to be his champion?
You want me to fight in the arena for you?
Yes. I need someone new. Someone who can create a stir.
I always wanted to see my name in lights. Maybe less dingy lights, but I'll roll with it.
Then you've found one, Bowdaar.
I prefer Grand Champion, and I'm always up for a fight.
That is the spirit I need.
I do a lot of questionable things, but I think I draw the line at blood sport.
I'm not interested in participating in blood sport.
I cannot fault you, but more lives will be saved than lost. Is that not worth the risk?
You have already made waves in the fighting circles here. One more bout is all I ask.
What's one more fight between friends? I'm in.
Come with me. We will approach my enemies with a new proposal.
You know how to make waves. It won't take much to get people talking.
I am pretty good at getting people's attention.... Okay, you got me.
Thank you.
Hylo says you have battled Vaylin and Arcann themselves. I ask you because I believe you can succeed.
Okay. What do I need to do?
You are already known to my enemies. We will approach them and propose a new offer.
Then you will fight for the freedom of many.
I will be your manager. We will register your fights and establish you in the pits.
When you are known, we will approach the slavers.
I've got some wins to my name. Hopefully it won't be a hard sell.
You know what to expect. I will howl your victories from the rooftops.
Any advice for the fights themselves?
Don't die.
You seem to be getting the easy side of this arrangement.
My first century of life was spent in places like that. You will endure much less.
Unless stated otherwise, the rules are simple: use everything you know to win.
May honor not forget you down there.
[Refuse Quest] No, sorry.
[Refuse Quest] I don't like the idea of this.
Disappointing. I'll have to find another way to free them.
That was all I needed. Unless you'd like a drink, we have no other business.
[Refuse Quest] Sorry, Bowie, I can't get wrapped up in this right now.
Hylo tells me you have much to worry about. I understand. I will find another way.
You are always welcome here.
Come in. Sit down. Try our off-worlder special.
I see that you're currently scheduled for an Arena battle.
You shouldn't keep the crowds waiting. Come talk to me when you're done.
I have arranged for us to practice against the training droids.
Let's do it!
I have some things to take care of first.
Return when you are ready.
It is strange to step into an arena again after so many years. I am glad I do not face this alone.
I honor my debt to you. Always.
